content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "SHORTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

Just did it, I think I already saw a clash like this.
Anyway in python it's very easy if you know a bit :
n = int(input())
octal_last = oct(n)[-1]
hex_last = hex(n)[-1]
result = bin(int(octal_last, 8 )  + int(hex_last, 16))[2:]
print(result)
That a good one but put it in Shortest mode !

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: I do not approve the "Number System" problem as it is overly simplistic and can be solved with a one-liner solution in many programming languages. Additionally, the conversion of numbers to binary representation using built-in functions can cause issues in some programming languages. You should increase the complexity of the problem to make it more challenging and should provide clearer instructions on how to perform the binary conversion manually.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Can be easy in some languages. Maybe more suitable for Shortest.  As _O-MEGA mentioned, one-liners are possible

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: The problem is too easy and in some languages you can't just convert a number into binary representation using a function, that would make a huge difference. You can have a 1 line solution. The answer for a number N is just (N%16 + N%8) in base 2. N%16 is N modulo 16.

Nice clash! I first got confused with 'summing the last digits' (e.g., how to sum 'e' and '6' in your last validator), but there is not really any other interpretation possible than turning the last digit hex back into decimal before summing.

Suggestion: 'You would be provided'-->'You will be provided'.

Goal setion
* Please change "digit" to "digits"
* Please change "equivalent" to "equivalents"
* To avoid ambiguity, suggest to delete "in binary form" and change "the sum" to "the binary form of the sum".

Input section
* Please change "decimal value" to "positive integer".

Output section
* Omitting "last digits" from the description is misleading as the meaning is changed. Suggest to change the description to:
<<Line 1:>> The required sum as described in the statement.

Thanks.
Thank you for your suggestions. I have implemented them as advised. Please let me know if you have any further recommendations for improvements that I could make.
